poem:
"Ode to the Keeper of Keepsakes"

In memory's kiln, his knowledge fired,
Henry Sandon, antique-souled and wise.
Custodian of relics desired,
Offering surprise in stories he supplied.
Porcelain tomes of history's tide,
He informed in silence, now silence lies.
His life, a rare artifact to abide,
In our hearts, his legacy resides.
